english_translation: Umar ibn al-Khattab haggled over a horse, rode it to test it, and it was damaged. He said to the man: Take your horse. The man said: No. Umar said: Let us appoint someone between us as arbitrator. The man said: Shuraih. They both brought their dispute to him. Shuraih said: O Commander of the Believers, take what you bought or return what you took. Umar said: Is judgment not like this? Go to Kufa. And he appointed him as judge over it. This was the first day he knew him on.

english_translation: Shuraih was the first to ask witnesses about matters in secret. When he was asked: O Abu Umayyah, have you done something new (in judgment)? He said: People have done new things, so I have done new things. And he would say to the witnesses when he suspected them but they had been just: I have not rejected you nor prevented you from testifying if you stand. But you are the ones who will bear judgment in this. Indeed, I only fear Allah through you, so fear for yourselves. If they refused but insisted on testifying though they were just, he would say to the one for whom he was judging: By Allah, I am indeed judging in your favor, but I see that you are a wrongdoer. However, I do not judge by supposition. I judge only by what is before me from evidence. And my judgment does not make lawful to you something Allah has forbidden for you. Go on.
